column4: i got the latest handbrake  , i am running ubuntu 9.10 x64 handbrake locks up after selecting dvd in sources and i cannot find the process to kill handbrake
anyone have any idea how to kill the handbrake process because "handbrake" is not in the process list
try ghb
it runs as that for me, don't know why
the process is ghb?
for me, yes
thanks i see it in the process any idea why it locks up?
no, sorry, it ran fine for me but I only used it twice
well i got the newer version today and before it ran fine for me too but now it seems like it locks up only when choosing the dvd drive
I have 0.9.4, maybe stick to that one, or are there useful new features?
yes better new x264 codec and several new things
try to run it from a terminal and see if there is useful output
good idea
yea no output in terminal but yet handbrake still fails lol
sorry, no clue
me either but thanks alot for the help
i found the issue, if anyone else asks.... installing the new HandBrake from deb does not automatically install the libdvdcss2
if this isnt install it will just freeze lol
yes but last time it auto installed so i assumed wrongly
cool, I'll keep that in mind
it does have many features you should check it out :D
